poem:
**Election Poster**

Morning: an election mask peels back,
violence inked on every flier.
Sanctions sift through a country's throat,
unacceptable bleeds through the cracks,
blunders sown in sanctioned fields.
"Intimidation," the headlines hum,
a waking world brushed with fresh bruises,
no place for peace in paper wars.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "French PM says ‘no place for violence and intimidation’ after candidate attacked putting up election posters – Europe live 8.45am BST Marine Le Pen has said that there are unacceptable comments from some National Rally candidates which will lead to sanctions but that some comments are blunders. Marine Le Pen (@MLP_officiel): "Il y a des propos inadmissibles (de candidats RN) qui entraineront des sanctions mais il y a des propos qui sont des maladresses" pic.twitter.com/MhoH0YwvdK—". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: French PM says ‘no place for violence and intimidation’ after candidate attacked putting up election posters – Europe live 8.45am BST Marine Le Pen has said that there are unacceptable comments from some National Rally candidates which will lead to sanctions but that some comments are blunders.
